1.text: My son, attend to my wisdom, and incline thy ear to my prudence.

2.text: That thou mayst keep thoughts, and thy lips may preserve instruction. Mind not the deceit of a woman.

3.text: For the lips of a harlot are like a honeycomb dropping, and her throat is smoother than oil.

4.text: But her end is bitter as wormwood, and sharp as a two-edged sword.

5.text: Her feet go down into death, and her steps go in as far as hell.

6.text: They walk not by the path of life, her steps are wandering, and unaccountable.

7.text: Now therefore, my son, hear me, and depart not from the words of my mouth.

8.text: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the doors of her house.

9.text: Give not thy honour to strangers, and thy years to the cruel.

10.text: Lest strangers be filled with thy strength, and thy labours be in another manâ€™s house,

11.text: And thou mourn it the last, when thou shalt have spent thy flesh and thy body, and say:

12.text: Why have I hated instruction, and my heart consented not to reproof,

13.text: And have not heard the voice of them that taught me, and have not in- dined my ear to masters?

14.text: I have almost been in all evil, in the midst of the church and of the congregation.

15.text: Drink water out of thy own cistern, and the streams of thy own well:

16.text: Let thy fountains be conveyed abroad, and in the streets divide thy waters.

17.text: Keep them to thyself alone, neither let strangers be partakers with thee.

18.text: Let thy vein be blessed, and rejoice with the wife of thy youth:

19.text: Let her be thy dearest hind, and most agreeable fawn: let her breasts inebriate thee at all times; he thou delighted continually with her love.

20.text: Why art thou seduced, my son, by a strange woman, and art cherished in the bosom of another ?

21.text: The Lord beholdeth the ways of man, and considereth all his steps.

22.text: His own iniquities catch the wicked, and he is fast bound with the ropes of his own sins.

23.text: He shall die, because he hath not received instruction, and in the multitude of his folly he shall be deceived.
